member_organisations:
Associated members of Stichting IPA (Parents International) form 3 groups: 
a.    Individuals who have an affinity with the Foundation's objective and / or widen their knowledge about it; 
b.    Parents’ Associations registering at their own initiative or at the invitation of Stichting IPA 
c.    Organisations and other legal entities who work with/for parents but not parents’ associations.
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Culture and media, Budget, Culture, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Business and Industry, Youth, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Communication
eu_initiatives:
All EU initiatives concerning parents and their children, with special focus on  
- the Pillar of Social Rights - especially ECEC, work-life balance and lifelong learning 
- learning and education initiatives such as the European Education Area 
- GDPR
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
